text: I intend to offer you nothing but plain reasoning, devoid of art and ornament; unsupported by the authority of any books or men how sacred soever
author: Benjamin Franklin
source: On the Providence of God in the Government of the World

text: I know that no authority is more convincing to men of reason than the authority of reason itself
author: Benjamin Franklin
source: On the Providence of God in the Government of the World

text: He has given us reason, to find out the truth, and the real design and true end of our existence
author: John Adams

text: Let the human mind loose. It must be loose; it will be loose. Superstition and despotism cannot confine it.
author: John Adams
source: Letter to John Quincy Adams, 13 November 1816

text: Reason and free enquiry are the only effectual agents against error
author: Thomas Jefferson
source: Notes on the State of Virginia, p. 285

text: I have but one lamp by which my feet are guided; and that is the lamp of experience. I know of no way of judging of the future but by the past.
author: Patrick Henry
